page.title: 20TOURISM - LANGRISH HOUSE
page.content: Langrish House is a common stop-over place for tourism and buisness men on weekend trips. Such tourists are American, German or French. The house also holds wedding receptions. You will find Langrish House in both the "Good{Hotel Guide}" and the{"Good Food {Guide}". The restaurant is open between 6.30p.m. and 9.30p.m. and the most expensive dish is for just under Â£10.00. The cost for one of the fifteen rooms is from Â£22.00 to about Â£30.00. There are not many employed in Langrish House (about ten): cooks, a secretary, a couple of gardeners and waiters. These people are most needed on Fridays and Saturdays. The peak months are July, August and September. The information for this area has been collected by pupils of 14 yrs from Churcher's College Petersfield.
